Odoo
WooCommerce
Connector v14

WooCommerce is an open-source eCommerce plugin on WordPress which provides a customizable platform for building your online business.

Ksolves presents to you WooCommerce v14, with all the latest reliable features which can propel businesses to new heights with its multi schema architecture. It lets you integrate & manage WooCommerce stores in Odoo and thus saves time by eliminating the need to go in the WooCommerce backend to handle things that can be managed from Odoo. Enjoy bi-directional data synchronization with our connector.

    Stocks.

Before installing Odoo WooCommerce Connector

Before installing our connector, first install requirements.txt file using command "pip install -r address-to-ks_WooCommerce/requirements.txt" in environment.

Creating & generating API keys from your WooCommerce website


  • Before using the module you need to generate the API from the WooCommerce Backend. In order to do the same, Go to WooCommerce > Settings > Click on Advanced

  • Once you click on “Advanced” tab, you need to create the API key which will be interacting with Odoo. In order to do the same, Go to, Advanced > Rest API > Click on Add keys

  • After clicking on “Add Keys” button, a page will be open, where you need to give the username and provide the permissions > Generate API key.

  • In order to maintain the keys for future use, you need to save them as shown below:

Creating & testing the WooCommerce Instance

After installing the module you will be able to view that there is WooCommerce Menu created where in WooCommerce menu you can create the instance. WooCommerce > Instance.
  • Click on the Create button to create a new instance.

  • Enter the name of your instance, WooCommerce Store URL, Consumer Key & Consumer Secret. If your WooCommerce store carries an SSL certificate, check ‘Verify SSL’, after putting all the information you can click on “Save” button.

  • Once you are done with creating the instance, you can test your connection by clicking on Connect Instance button If everything is added properly you will receive a message on the same page “Connection Successful”. In case the connection is not successful you can correct the information entered.

Configure & activate the WooCommerce instance

After your instance get connected, you need to setup basic details for WooCommerce instance.
  • In Configuration tab you need to fill the below details as stated:
    Warehouse: Select the warehouse from where you wish to manage WooCommerce Inventory.
    Currency: Select the currency used by your WooCommerce Store.

  • In Configuration tab you need to fill the below details as stated:
    Woo Sync/Import Images?: Enable, if want to import images with product.
    Woo Sync/Import Price?: Enable, if want to import prices with product.

  • In Configuration tab you need to fill the below details as stated:
    Payment Configurations: Select the Payment Terms

  • In Order tab you need to complete the below details as stated:
    Auto Order Status Update to Woo: Automatically updates the order status to Woo Commerce if updated on Odoo Side
    Order Prefix: Enter the prefix you want to be named as sale order name.
    Order Status: Enter the status of order which can be imported from WooCommerce
    Sales Team: Select the Sales Team for WooCommerce Orders
    Sales Person: Select the Sales Person for WooCommerce Orders
    WooCommerce Fees: Select the Fees Product for WooCommerce orders
    Email Configurations: Enter email where you all sale order reporting will be sent everyday

  • In Tax Information tab you need to fill the details for Tax handlings

  • In Stock Information tab you need to fill the details for stock handlings

  • In Webhooks tab you will configure webhooks for various domains and that will be automatically reflected on WooCommerce. Now no need to fizzy way of url management, just create the webhook all you are required to do.

  • After Configuring all the required fields, click on "Active Instance" to perform the synchronization operations.

Odoo WooCommerce Connector Dashboard

You can overview the details of all the connectivity domains and all the graphical information about the coonnector.

Sales Reporting

You can now visualize all your sales report and have insights about your sales data
Click on the Reporting Menu of the WooCommerce then Sales.
Sales Reporting graph view opens where we can see all our visuals with various measures
PIVOT view for all the quantative analysis.

Sale AutoWorkflow

Automate sale order processes with the sale workflow. With sale workflow you can handle invoicing and delivery processes.
Click on Configurations > Sale Workflow
Click create button on sale workflow model
Fill all the details and assign boolean for respective invoicing and sales processes.
Now whenever the sale order will be imported , Sale autoworkflow id will be assigned to that particular sale order.
Cron will process that particular sale order with the configuration provided.

WooCommerce Logs

Click on Processes and then Go to Logs
This will allow user to view the entire logs of the operations with respect to unsuccessful and successful status, so that you can keep a track on the records synced. Success and Failed logs both are intuitive and descriptive with graph view and list view.

Inventory Adjustment

Click on Dashboard Inventory Adjustment button to open Inventory adjustment
This will allow user to do inventory adjustment of imported stock using date filter according to instance.

Import Specific Record

This will allow user to perform specific operations for particular instance.
Select the instance and model and the operation flow to import record.
Fill WooCommerce Id in numeric, for multiple records separate them using pipe ",".

Multiple Operations

This will allow user to perform multiple operations for multiple instance.
Select the instance and model and the operation flow to import record.
Select multiple operations and then click Execute to add them into the queue process.

WooCommerce Meta Mappings

This will allow user to perform extra plugin wordpress data sync to woocommerce
The brand new meta-mapping feature has been introduced which comes with a dedicated meta-mapping page. To map, users have to enter the Odoo model where meta-mapping needs to be applied along with the meta key for the API being used. Next, the meta-mapping field has to be filled. Once done, the meta-mapping feature can be activated with a click.

Direct Syncing Process

Simplified and Compact data syncing process Now just create your record for any specific model i.e Products, Contact etc and Sync the data back and through WooCommerce.
Believe it or not, synchronization can be done now in seconds! The days for multiple clicks, backend operations to synchronize Odoo & WooCommerce is over now. Utilizing the Push To WooCommerce and Pull From WooCommerce buttons, syncing is done with a single click.
User can find the complete User Guide of Odoo WooCommerce Connector inside ks_woocommerce/documentation/user_guide folder.

Frequently Asked Question

Need some customization in this app, whom to contact?
Please drop email at sales@ksolves.com or raise a ticket through Odoo store itself.
Do you provide any free support?
Yes, we do provide free support for 90 days for any queries or any bug/issue fixing.
Is this app compatible with Multi Currency?
Yes, our app supports Multi Currency.
Is this app compatible with Odoo Enterprise?
Yes, our app works with Odoo Enterprise as well as Community.
Does this app sync WooCommerce coupons?
Yes, you can sync coupons data.
Does it supports sub-sub-categories's import/export?
Yes, with this app you can move sub-sub-categories from Woo-Commerce to Odoo and vice-versa.
Does this app supports webhooks?
Yes, this app supports webhooks with multiple database flexibility.
FREE 90 DAYS SUPPORT

Ksolves will provide FREE 90 days support for any doubt, queries, and bug fixing (excluding data recovery) or any type of issues related to this module. This is applicable from the date of purchase.
